title: The 2,548 Best Things Anybody Ever Said (gnv64)
description:
The 2,548 Best Things Anybody Ever Said 
By Robert Byrne
Touchstone | January 2003 | ISBN-10: 0743235797 | ePUB/MOBI | 10.2/10.7 mb

Drawing from diverse personages -- Goethe to Churchill to Woody Allen -- Robert Byrne has mined a collection of wit and wisdom that deserves a special place on every humor lover's bookshelf. These unique, witty, and outrageous quotations, previously published in four separate volumes, are now gathered together in a seemingly limitless trove of pithy and often irreverent one-liners, retorts, put-downs, jokes, and last words that cover every conceivable subject and will appeal to every taste.

About the Author
Robert Byrne is the author of seven novels, five collections of humorous quotations, seven books on billiards, and an exposÃ© of frauds in the literary world. Byrne was born and raised in Dubuque, Iowa, where he has a regular humor column in the Dubuque Herald Times. 

CONTENTS
Introduction
The 2,548 Best Things Anybody Ever Said
Sources, References, and Notes
Principal Sources of Artwork
Index of Authors
Index of Subjects and Key Words
